ownProject.projectDescription: I developed a Quiz App using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark> with several key features. It uses local <mark>storage</mark> to save questions, answers, and high scores, ensuring progress is maintained. The app includes a score-sharing feature with <mark>html2canvas</mark>, allowing users to take and share screenshots of their scores. Additionally, if a user quits mid-quiz, the app will remember their progress and resume from that point next time, making it user-friendly and engaging.

I created a To-Do List App using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark>. The app utilizes <mark>local storage</mark> to save tasks and includes a <mark>progress bar</mark> to visualize task completion. It features <mark>dynamic quotes</mark> that change based on progress, providing motivation. Moreover, the app automatically <mark>deletes lists</mark> at the end of each day, ensuring a fresh start daily. These functionalities combine to create a practical, motivating, and user-friendly experience.

I developed a comprehensive country list website using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark> leveraging the REST Countries API. The site features 250 countries with <mark>region filtering</mark> and <mark>name search</mark> options. Each country page offers <mark>detailed information</mark> and allows exploration of <mark>neighboring countries</mark> By click in Name. Users can switch between <mark>light and dark mode</mark>, with preferences saved in <mark>local storage</mark>, ensuring an interactive and personalized browsing experience.

I created a Job List App using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark>. This app lists jobs from various companies and enhances the job search experience with robust features. Users can filter jobs based on <mark>level</mark>, <mark>language</mark>, and <mark>position</mark> by clicking on tags, supporting multiple filter options for efficient search refinement. These features make job searching more <mark>efficient</mark> and <mark>user-friendly</mark>, ensuring users can find the most relevant job opportunities quickly.

I created an Age Calculator using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark>. Users can calculate their age with built-in validations such as ensuring the <mark>day is within the last date of the month</mark>, the <mark>year is not in the future</mark>, and the <mark>month is between 1 and 12</mark>. These features ensure the app is practical, motivating, and <mark>user-friendly</mark>, providing an accurate age calculation experience.

I created a Music Player App using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark> with several advanced features. The app supports basic controls such as <mark>play</mark>, <mark>pause</mark>, <mark>next</mark>, and <mark>previous</mark>, accessible via both keyboard and mouse. It features an advanced <mark>progress bar</mark> that dynamically updates with the music's progress, showing both the <mark>progress time</mark> and <mark>total time</mark> of the track. Users can interactively change the current playback time by clicking on the <mark>progress bar</mark>. The app also includes indicators for <mark>current</mark> and <mark>total music numbers</mark>. Upon completing a track, it automatically transitions to the next one and <mark>loops back</mark> to the first track after playing all songs.

I created an insurance company landing page using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark>. The page utilizes <mark>AOS (Animate On Scroll)</mark> for smooth scroll animations, dynamically revealing elements. It features <mark>responsive styling</mark> to ensure optimal appearance and functionality across all devices, enhancing user experience.
This is a Game to Guess The Random Number
This is a Typer app to write and delete words atomatically with loop.
This is a search engine where we can search anything with any provider (e.g: google, bing)
This is small project to fetch Users Data from github using fetch()

freelanceProject.projectDescription: I worked for a client to create a comprehensive website from Scratch using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark>. The website features <mark>nine pages</mark>, including an apply page where applicants can submit their details. These details are stored in <mark>Google Sheets</mark>, and <mark>email notifications</mark> are sent to both the owner and the applicant upon submission. I integrated <mark>Swiper JS</mark> for responsive sliders, <mark>Typed JS</mark> for dynamic text effects, and <mark>jsPDF</mark> to merge image files into a single PDF. The PDF is then uploaded to <mark>Google Drive</mark>, and its link is stored in the sheet. Additionally, I implemented a feature that allows the owner to retrieve <mark>specific applicant details from Google Sheets</mark> by entering the applicant's name, streamlining the application management process.

I built a shop website for <mark>Maitri Studio</mark>, a Common Service Center (<mark>CSC</mark>), using <mark>HTML</mark>, <mark>CSS</mark>, and <mark>JavaScript</mark>. The website showcases their <mark>services</mark> in an intuitive and engaging manner. I used <mark>Swiper JS</mark> to implement dynamic, touch-friendly image sliders, enhancing the user experience. Additionally, I integrated <mark>Google Apps Script</mark> to fetch and display files directly from <mark>Google Drive</mark>, ensuring the website stays up-to-date with the latest service offerings. The project highlights my ability to create responsive, interactive, and user-friendly websites from scratch, leveraging modern libraries and tools to meet client needs.
